label: FGRGBW
info_overview: Fibaro RGBW Controller is a universal, Z-Wave compatible RGB / RGBW controller. Fibaro RGBW Controller uses PWM output signal, which enables it to control LED, RGB, RGBW strips, halogen lights and fans. Controlled devices may be powered by 12 or 24 VDC. In addition the device supports up to four, 0V - 10V analog sensors, such as temperature sensors, humidity sensors, wind sensors, air quality sensors, light sensors etc. All IN and OUT terminals may be user configured for LED control or 0V-10V signal readouts.
info_inclusion: Triple click the B-button or any switch connected to I1-I4 inputs
info_exclusion: Triple click the B-button or any switch connected to I1-I4 inputs
info_usage:
Warning!

  1. Fibaro RGBW Controller is dedicated to operate in low voltage circuits of 12VDC or 24VDC. Connecting higher voltage load may result in Fibaro RGBW Controller damage.
  2. Fibaro RGBW Controller must be powered by the same voltage as the connected light source. I.e. if controlling 12V LED strip, the module must be connected to 12V power supply. Similarly, if controlling 24V RGBW strip, Fibaro RGBW Controller must be powered by 24V voltage supply.
  3. Fibaro RGBW Controller has 0-10V input. There is no 0-10V output. Output is controlled by PWM at 244Hz.
  4. Fibaro RGBW Controller must be powered by 12VDC or 24 VDC stabilized power supply with outputs load capacity matched to loads voltage.
  5. Sensors using 0-10V interface use wire connection to inputs I1 - I4. Maximum length of 0-10V connection line is 10 m. Observe sensor's manufacturer recommendations towards 0-10V line diameter.
  6. In case of connecting long RGBW/RGB/LED strips voltage drops may occur, resulting in lower light brightness further from R/G/B/W outputs. To eliminate this effect it's recommended to connect few shorter strips in serial connection instead of one long strip connected parallel. Maximum recommended wire length, used to connect R/G/B/W outputs with a RGBW/RGB/LED strip is 10 m. Observe connected loads manufacturer recommendations towards connection wire diameter.
category_description: Any device attached to the wall that controls a binary status of something, for ex. a light switch

parameters.label: ALL ON / ALL OFF function activation
parameters.description: Activation/deactivation of ALL ON/ALL OFF functions.
parameters.overview: By default, ALL ON active ALL OFF active.

options.label: ALL ON active ALL OFF active
ALL ON inactive ALL OFF inactive
ALL ON inactive ALL OFF active
ALL ON active ALL OFF inactive

parameters.label: Outputs state change mode
parameters.description: MODE1, Example: change saturation level from 0% to 99%
parameters.overview: Parameter 9: Step = 5, Parameter 10: Time between steps: 10ms, Default setting: MODE1

options.label: MODE2
options.overview: MODE2 (related parameters: 11-time to change value, relevant for RGB/R

parameters.label: Time between steps (relevant for MODE1)
parameters.overview: Default setting: 10 ms  0 - immediate change of state, available settings: 1 - 60000 ms.

parameters.label: Time for changing from start to end value
Inputs/Outputs configuration
parameters.description: Relevant for main controllers other than Home Center 2 only
parameters.overview:
Inputs/Outputs configuration - relevant for main controllers other than Home Center 2 only.
Default setting: 4369, Controlled device: RGBW, toggle switch inputs (NORMAL MODE).

parameters.label: Remember device status after power failure
parameters.description: Define how will the Plug react after the power supply is back on.
parameters.overview: Define how will the Plug react after the power supply is back on.

parameters.label: Alarm response
parameters.overview:
Alarm of any type (General alarm, flood alarm, smoke alarm: CO, CO2, temperature alarm.)                             

Default setting: INACTIVE

options.label: INACTIVE
options.overview: INACTIVE - the device doesn't respond to alarm frames

options.label: ALARM ON
options.overview: ALARM ON - the device turns on once alarm is detected (all channels set to 99%)

options.label: ALARM OFF
options.overview: ALARM OFF - the device turns off once alarm is detected (all channels set to 0%)

options.label: ALARM PROGRAM
options.overview: ALARM PROGRAM - alarm sequence turns on (program selected in parameter 38)

parameters.label: Active PROGRAM alarm time
parameters.overview: Default setting: 600s, 1-65534 specifies alarm time in seconds.

parameters.label: Command class reporting Outputs status change
parameters.description: Command class reporting Outputs status change.

options.label: Inputs and controllers actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
options.overview: reporting as a result of inputs and controllers actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)

options.label: Inputs actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)
options.overview: reporting as a result inputs actions (SWITCH MULTILEVEL)

options.label: Inputs actions (COLOR CONTROL)
options.overview: Reporting as a result of inputs actions (COLOR CONTROL)

parameters.label: Reporting 0-10v analog inputs change threshold
parameters.description: Defines which input voltage must change to be reported
parameters.overview:
Parameter defines a value by which input voltage must change in order to be reported to the main controller.
New value is calculated based on last reported value, default setting: 5

parameters.label: Power load reporting frequency
parameters.overview: Parameter defines Time between reports. The report will be sent if last reported value differs from the current value, else reports will also be sent in case of polling. Default setting: 3 600 (s)

parameters.label: Reporting energy consumption changes
parameters.overview: Defines the required change in power to generate an unsolicited power report. New, reported energy value is calculated based on last reported value. Default setting: 10 (0,1 kWh).

options.label: Set to white (all channels controlled together)
options.overview: illumination colour set to white (all channels controlled together)

parameters.label: Starting animation program
parameters.description: Starting predefined program when device set to work in RGB/RGBW mode
parameters.overview: Starting predefined program when device set to work in RGB/RGBW mode (parameter 14) - relevant for main controllers other than Home Center 2 only. Default setting: 1

options.label: NODE INFO control frame is sent

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.
